title: 113_s2076
content: The Act may be cited as the "U.S. Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors Enhancement Act". It pertains to the United States Merchant Marine Academy Board of Visitors. Section 51312 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to establish a Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy. The Board will provide independent advice and recommendations on Academy matters. Membership includes Senators and House members appointed by respective committees. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by the Vice President, Speaker of the House, President, and ex officio members from Senate and House committees. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by the Vice President, Speaker of the House, President, and ex officio members from Senate and House committees. The Board consists of various members including the chairman of the Advisory Board to the Academy, a member of the House of Representatives from the Academy's congressional district, and presidential appointees with specific qualifications such as being Academy graduates or senior corporate officers from maritime shipping companies participating in relevant programs. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy includes members appointed by various officials and agencies, with specific qualifications for some members such as being Academy graduates or senior corporate officers from maritime shipping companies. Members serve for a 2-year term and vacancies are filled promptly. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy appoints members with specific qualifications, who serve for a 2-year term. Vacancies are promptly filled by designated replacements. Members can designate substitutes to attend Board activities if unable to participate. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy appoints members with specific qualifications for a 2-year term. Vacancies are filled promptly with designated replacements who must meet certain requirements. Substitutes designated by members can fully participate in Board activities and report back within 15 days. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy appoints members with specific qualifications for a 2-year term. Vacancies are filled promptly with designated replacements who can fully participate in Board activities and report back within 15 days. The Board selects a Chairperson from among its members on a biennial basis, with alternating members from the House of Representatives and Senate. The Chairperson cannot serve more than 1 consecutive term. The Board meets several times each year as outlined in the Charter. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy meets several times a year as outlined in the Charter. They also visit the Academy annually and may make other visits in connection with their duties. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy has access to grounds, facilities, and personnel for carrying out their duties. They are responsible for investigating morale, discipline, curriculum, fiscal affairs, and other relevant matters. The Secretary of Transportation provides necessary support and selects a Designated Federal Officer to assist the Board. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy has the authority to designate staff members to serve without reimbursement. They are allowed travel expenses while serving away from home. The Board must submit annual reports to the President regarding their actions, views, and recommendations pertaining to the Academy. The Board of Visitors for the United States Merchant Marine Academy can prepare and submit reports to the President, Secretary of Transportation, Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation, and House Committee on Armed Services. They may also call in advisers for consultation and report preparation. The Senate passed the document on June 26, 2014, attested by Nancy Erickson, Secretary.
